docs.title: I'm happy to share my mkdocs for testing, implementing git hub
Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.
  • http://127.0.0.1:8000/database/

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: Texto en negrita, cursiva y tachado
Tablas
docs.text: Nombre Ey Mensaje Neme tú puedes

docs.title: Imágenes:dentro e la carpeta de docs subir la imagen
Bloques de código
docs.text: Usa el comando git status para ver los cambios.

docs.title: Desplegar en GitHub Pages
docs.text:
• checar el repositorio en GitHub (público o privado).
  • ejecutar en la carpeta de donde esta vpenadocs
  • C:\Users\neme_\vpena-docs> mkdocs gh-deploy
  • Para forzar el deploy: mkdocs gh-deploy --force
  • ir a mi ghpages: https://vpenat81.github.io/vpenadocs/ link

docs.title: Opcional pero recomendable si no carga en github
docs.text:
1 Limpia tu sitio local - Windows powershell: rmdir /s /q site - Linux bash: rm -rf site

2 Reconstruye tu sitio - mkdocs build - mkdocs gh-deploy --force (le dice a MkDocs que reemplace lo que ya está en la rama gh-pages, incluso si no detecta cambios)

docs.title: Base de datos
docs.text:
Una tabla en MySQL es una estructura dentro de una base de datos que organiza los datos en filas y columnas, como si fuera una hoja de cálculo.

Cada fila (row) representa un registro individual, y cada columna (column) representa un campo de dato

Ejemplo: Una tabla alumnos podría tener columnas como id, nombre, edad, correo, etc., y cada fila representa un alumno distinto.

docs.title: Ejemplo de tabla en SQL
docs.text: ```sql title="Crear tabla alumnos" CREATE TABLE alumnos ( id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY, nombre VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL, edad INT, correo VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE );

docs.title: email ##
docs.text:
Breakdown email response, step by step.

Subject line Subject: Update on Reported Issue - WHY: the subject line should be clear and professional.

Greeting: Dear user name WHY: Always use a formal greeting in professional emails. Polite

Aknowledge the issue: Thank you for bringing this matter to our attention WHY: Aknowledding the issue right away shows that you are listening valuaing the user´s concerns. demonstrating professionalism and empathy. Action Steps: At this moment, Iam in the process of investigating the issue. WHY: Here I have to detail the actions that I'm taking to resolve the issue. By mentioning specific actions (like investigatin the issue, assessing performance, and collaboration with technical team).

Next Steps/Timeline: We will keep you update on our progress WHY: giving an update on the next steps is important in formal commun

Offer Additional support: Please do not hesitate to reach out if you ave any further questions or need additional assistance in the meantime. WHY: Offering further assistance makes the recipient feel supported.

Closing: than you for your patience and understanding. WHY: This is a polite way to express gratitude for the user's patience during the resolution process.

Sign-off: Best Regards WHY: best regards is a formal and polite way to sign off. Including your name, position, and contact information.

Example.

Greeting: Dear user Acknowledge the Issue Thank you for bringing this matter to our attention. I would like to assure you that we are currently reviewing the incident you reported regarding the functionality of the platform. Action Steps At this moment, I am in the process of investigating the issue. The initial step I have taken is to assess the application’s performance and identify the root cause of the problem. Additionally, I am collaborating with our technical team to ensure a thorough evaluation. Next Steps / Timeline: We will keep you updated on our progress and, once the issue is identified, we will prioritize its resolution. I will make sure to provide you with an estimated timeline for the fix as soon as we have more information. Offer Additional Support: Please do not hesitate to reach out if you have any further questions or need additional assistance in the meantime. We are committed to resolving this matter promptly and ensuring the continued reliability of the platform. Closing: Thank you for your patience and understanding. Sign-off: Best regards, [Your Name] [Your Position] [Your Contact Information]

docs.title: Documentation how to deploy my docs on mkdocs
docs.text:
My mkdocs link https://vpenat81.github.io/vpenadocs/

Workflow Summary Edit your .md files in docs/

  1. Update mkdocs.yml to reflect new pages

  2. Run mkdocs serve to preview

  3. Run git add ., git commit -m "...", git push

  4. Deploy with mkdocs gh-deploy

docs.title: Commands (after editing)
docs.text: Command What it does mkdocs serve Preview docs live at http://127.0.0.1:8000/ mkdocs build Builds the updated site into the site/ folder mkdocs gh-deploy Publishes your changes to GitHub Pages

docs.title: Sintaxis básica de Markdown
docs.text: Encabezados: Se crean usando el carácter # seguido de texto. Por ejemplo, # Titulo Principal genera un encabezado de nivel 1. Texto en negrita: Se puede lograr envolviendo el texto con dos asteriscos ** o dos guiones bajos __. Por ejemplo, Esto es negrita. Texto en cursiva: Se puede lograr envolviendo el texto con un asterisco * o un guión bajo _. Por ejemplo, Esto es cursiva. Listas: Se crean usando los símbolos -, *, o + para listas no ordenadas, y usando números seguidos de un punto para listas ordenadas. Enlaces: Se crean usando la sintaxis Texto del enlace. Imágenes: Se crean usando la sintaxis !Texto alternativo. Bloques de código: Se pueden crear utilizando tres backticks ```` al inicio y al final del bloque de código.
